member.name: M:SYSSTATS_Charter.Program.Main
member.summary: The main entry point for the application.

member.name: T:SYSSTATS_Charter.Properties.Resources
member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.Properties.Resources.ResourceManager
member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.Properties.Resources.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.Properties.Resources.SYSSTAT_Charter
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to <?xml version="1.0"?> <doc> <assembly> <name>SYSSTAT-Charter</name> </assembly> <members> <member name="M:SYSSTATS_Charter.Program.Main"> <summary> The main entry point for the application. </summary> </member> <member name="T:SYSSTATS_Charter.Properties.Resources"> <summary> A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc. </summary> </member> [rest of string was truncated]";.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.BlockDeviceActivity.Tps
member.summary: Total number of transfers per second that were issued to physical devices. A transfer is an I/O request to a physical device. Multiple logical requests can be combined into a single I/O request to the device. A transfer is of indeterminate size.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.BlockDeviceActivity.RkBPerSec
member.summary: Number of kilobytes read from the device per second.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.BlockDeviceActivity.WkBPerSec
member.summary: Number of kilobytes written to the device per second.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.BlockDeviceActivity.DkBPerSec
member.summary: Number of kilobytes discarded for the device per second.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.BlockDeviceActivity.Areqsz
member.summary: The average size (in kilobytes) of the I/O requests that were issued to the device. Note: In previous versions, this field was known as avgrq-sz and was expressed in sectors.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.BlockDeviceActivity.Aqusz
member.summary: The average queue length of the requests that were issued to the device. Note: In previous versions, this field was known as avgqu-sz.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.BlockDeviceActivity.Await
member.summary: The average time (in milliseconds) for I/O requests issued to the device to be served. This includes the time spent by the requests in queue and the time spent servicing them.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.BlockDeviceActivity.Util
member.summary: Percentage of elapsed time during which I/O requests were issued to the device (bandwidth utilization for the device). Device saturation occurs when this value is close to 100% for devices serving requests serially. But for devices serving requests in parallel, such as RAID arrays and modern SSDs, this number does not reflect their performance limits.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.CPUUtilization.Usr
member.summary: Percentage of CPU utilization that occurred while executing at the user level (application). Note that this field does NOT include time spent running virtual processors.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.CPUUtilization.Nice
member.summary: Percentage of CPU utilization that occurred while executing at the user level with nice priority.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.CPUUtilization.System
member.summary: Percentage of CPU utilization that occurred while executing at the system level (kernel). Note that this field includes time spent servicing hardware and software interrupts.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.CPUUtilization.Sys
member.summary: Percentage of CPU utilization that occurred while executing at the system level (kernel). Note that this field does NOT include time spent servicing hardware or software interrupts.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.CPUUtilization.IOWait
member.summary: Percentage of time that the CPU or CPUs were idle during which the system had an outstanding disk I/O request.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.CPUUtilization.Steal
member.summary: Percentage of time spent in involuntary wait by the virtual CPU or CPUs while the hypervisor was servicing another virtual processor.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.CPUUtilization.IRQ
member.summary: Percentage of time spent by the CPU or CPUs to service hardware interrupts.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.CPUUtilization.Soft
member.summary: Percentage of time spent by the CPU or CPUs to service software interrupts.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.CPUUtilization.Guest
member.summary: Percentage of time spent by the CPU or CPUs to run a virtual processor.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.CPUUtilization.Gnice
member.summary: Percentage of time spent by the CPU or CPUs to run a niced guest.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.CPUUtilization.Idle
member.summary: Percentage of time that the CPU or CPUs were idle and the system did not have an outstanding disk I/O request.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.HugePagesUtilization.Kbhugfree
member.summary: Amount of hugepages memory in kilobytes that is not yet allocated.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.HugePagesUtilization.Kbhugused
member.summary: Amount of hugepages memory in kilobytes that has been allocated.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.HugePagesUtilization.Hugused
member.summary: Percentage of total hugepages memory that has been allocated.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.HugePagesUtilization.Kbhugrsvd
member.summary: Amount of reserved hugepages memory in kilobytes.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.HugePagesUtilization.Kbhugsurp
member.summary: Amount of surplus hugepages memory in kilobytes.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.KernelTablesStatus.Dentunusd
member.summary: Number of unused cache entries in the directory cache.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.KernelTablesStatus.FileNum
member.summary: Number of file handles used by the system.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.KernelTablesStatus.InodeNum
member.summary: Number of inode handlers used by the system.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.KernelTablesStatus.PtyNum
member.summary: Number of pseudo-terminals used by the system.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.MemoryUtilization.Kbmemfree
member.summary: Amount of free memory available in kilobytes.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.MemoryUtilization.Kbavail
member.summary: Estimate of how much memory in kilobytes is available for starting new applications, without swapping. The estimate takes into account that the system needs some page cache to function well, and that not all reclaimable slab will be reclaimable, due to items being in use. The impact of those factors will vary from system to system.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.MemoryUtilization.Kbmemused
member.summary: Amount of used memory in kilobytes (calculated as total installed memory - kbmemfree - kbbuffers - kbcached - kbslab).

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.MemoryUtilization.Memused
member.summary: Percentage of used memory.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.MemoryUtilization.Kbbuffers
member.summary: Amount of memory used as buffers by the kernel in kilobytes.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.MemoryUtilization.Kbcached
member.summary: Amount of memory used to cache data by the kernel in kilobytes.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.MemoryUtilization.Kbcommit
member.summary: Amount of memory in kilobytes needed for current workload. This is an estimate of how much RAM/swap is needed to guarantee that there never is out of memory.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.MemoryUtilization.Commit
member.summary: Percentage of memory needed for current workload in relation to the total amount of memory (RAM+swap). This number may be greater than 100% because the kernel usually overcommits memory.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.MemoryUtilization.Kbactive
member.summary: Amount of active memory in kilobytes (memory that has been used more recently and usually not reclaimed unless absolutely necessary).

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.MemoryUtilization.Kbinact
member.summary: Amount of inactive memory in kilobytes (memory which has been less recently used. It is more eligible to be reclaimed for other purposes).

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.MemoryUtilization.Kbdirty
member.summary: Amount of memory in kilobytes waiting to get written back to the disk.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.MemoryUtilization.Kbanonpg
member.summary: Amount of non-file backed pages in kilobytes mapped into userspace page tables.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.MemoryUtilization.Kbslab
member.summary: Amount of memory in kilobytes used by the kernel to cache data structures for its own use.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.MemoryUtilization.Kbkstack
member.summary: Amount of memory in kilobytes used for kernel stack space.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.MemoryUtilization.Kbpgtbl
member.summary: Amount of memory in kilobytes dedicated to the lowest level of page tables.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.MemoryUtilization.Kbvmused
member.summary: Amount of memory in kilobytes of used virtual address space.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.NetworkErrors.RxerrPerSec
member.summary: Total number of bad packets received per second.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.NetworkErrors.TxerrPerSec
member.summary: Total number of errors that happened per second while transmitting packets.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.NetworkErrors.CollPerSec
member.summary: Number of collisions that happened per second while transmitting packets.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.NetworkErrors.RxdropPerSec
member.summary: Number of received packets dropped per second because of a lack of space in linux buffers.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.NetworkErrors.TxdropPerSec
member.summary: Number of transmitted packets dropped per second because of a lack of space in linux buffers.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.NetworkErrors.TxcarrPerSEc
member.summary: Number of carrier-errors that happened per second while transmitting packets.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.NetworkErrors.RxframPerSec
member.summary: Number of frame alignment errors that happened per second on received packets.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.NetworkErrors.RxfifoPerSec
member.summary: Number of FIFO overrun errors that happened per second on received packets.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.NetworkErrors.TxfifoPerSec
member.summary: Number of FIFO overrun errors that happened per second on transmitted packets.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.NetworkStatistics.IFACE
member.summary: Name of the network interface for which statistics are reported.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.NetworkStatistics.RxpckPerSec
member.summary: Total number of packets received per second.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.NetworkStatistics.TxpckPerSec
member.summary: Total number of packets transmitted per second.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.NetworkStatistics.RxkBPerSec
member.summary: Total number of kilobytes received per second.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.NetworkStatistics.TxkBPerSec
member.summary: Total number of kilobytes transmitted per second.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.NetworkStatistics.RxcmpPerSec
member.summary: Number of compressed packets received per second (for cslip etc.).

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.NetworkStatistics.TxcmpPerSEc
member.summary: Number of compressed packets transmitted per second.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.NetworkStatistics.RxmcstPerSec
member.summary: Number of multicast packets received per second.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.NetworkStatistics.Ifutil
member.summary: Utilization percentage of the network interface. For half-duplex interfaces, utilization is calculated using the sum of rxkB/s and txkB/s as a percentage of the interface speed. For full-duplex, this is the greater of rxkB/S or txkB/s.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.NFSClientActivity.CallPerSec
member.summary: Number of RPC requests made per second.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.NFSClientActivity.RetransPerSec
member.summary: Number of RPC requests per second, those which needed to be retransmitted (for example because of a server timeout).

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.NFSClientActivity.ReadPerSec
member.summary: Number of 'read' RPC calls made per second.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.NFSClientActivity.WritePerSec
member.summary: Number of 'write' RPC calls made per second.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.NFSClientActivity.AccessPerSec
member.summary: Number of 'access' RPC calls made per second.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.NFSClientActivity.GetattPerSec
member.summary: Number of 'getattr' RPC calls made per second.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.NFSServerActivity.ScallPerSec
member.summary: Number of RPC requests received per second.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.NFSServerActivity.BadcallPerSec
member.summary: Number of bad RPC requests received per second, those whose processing generated an error.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.NFSServerActivity.PacketPerSec
member.summary: Number of network packets received per second.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.NFSServerActivity.UdpPerSec
member.summary: Number of UDP packets received per second.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.NFSServerActivity.TcpPerSec
member.summary: Number of TCP packets received per second.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.NFSServerActivity.HitPerSEc
member.summary: Number of reply cache hits per second.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.NFSServerActivity.MissPerSec
member.summary: Number of reply cache misses per second.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.NFSServerActivity.SreadPerSec
member.summary: Number of 'read' RPC calls received per second.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.NFSServerActivity.SwritePerSec
member.summary: Number of 'write' RPC calls received per second.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.NFSServerActivity.SaccessPerSec
member.summary: Number of 'access' RPC calls received per second.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.NFSServerActivity.SgetattPerSec
member.summary: Number of 'getattr' RPC calls received per second.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.PagingStatistics.PgpginPerSec
member.summary: Total number of kilobytes the system paged in from disk per second.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.PagingStatistics.PgpgoutPerSec
member.summary: Total number of kilobytes the system paged out to disk per second.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.PagingStatistics.FaultPerSec
member.summary: Number of page faults (major + minor) made by the system per second. This is not a count of page faults that generate I/O, because some page faults can be resolved without I/O.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.PagingStatistics.MajfltPerSec
member.summary: Number of major faults the system has made per second, those which have required loading a memory page from disk.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.PagingStatistics.PgfreePerSec
member.summary: Number of pages placed on the free list by the system per second.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.PagingStatistics.PgscankPerSec
member.summary: Number of pages scanned by the kswapd daemon per second.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.PagingStatistics.PgscandPerSec
member.summary: Number of pages scanned directly per second.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.PagingStatistics.PgstealPerSec
member.summary: Number of pages the system has reclaimed from cache (pagecache and swapcache) per second to satisfy its memory demands.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.PagingStatistics.Vmeff
member.summary: Calculated as pgsteal / pgscan, this is a metric of the efficiency of page reclaim. If it is near 100% then almost every page coming off the tail of the inactive list is being reaped. If it gets too low (e.g. less than 30%) then the virtual memory is having some difficulty. This field is displayed as zero if no pages have been scanned during the interval of time.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.QueueLoadStatistics.Runqsz
member.summary: Run queue length (number of tasks waiting for run time).

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.QueueLoadStatistics.Plistsz
member.summary: Number of tasks in the task list.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.QueueLoadStatistics.Ldavg1
member.summary: System load average for the last minute. The load average is calculated as the average number of runnable or running tasks (R state), and the number of tasks in uninterruptible sleep (D state) over the specified interval.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.QueueLoadStatistics.Ldavg5
member.summary: System load average for the past 5 minutes.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.QueueLoadStatistics.Ldavg15
member.summary: System load average for the past 15 minutes.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.QueueLoadStatistics.Blocked
member.summary: Number of tasks currently blocked, waiting for I/O to complete.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.SocketStatistics.Totsck
member.summary: Total number of sockets used by the system.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.SocketStatistics.Tcpsck
member.summary: Number of TCP sockets currently in use.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.SocketStatistics.Udpsck
member.summary: Number of UDP sockets currently in use.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.SocketStatistics.Rawsck
member.summary: Number of RAW sockets currently in use.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.SocketStatistics.Ipfrag
member.summary: Number of IP fragments currently in queue.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.SocketStatistics.Tcptw
member.summary: Number of TCP sockets in TIME_WAIT state.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.SoftwareNetwork.TotalPerSec
member.summary: The total number of network frames processed per second.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.SoftwareNetwork.DropdPerSec
member.summary: The total number of network frames dropped per second because there was no room on the processing queue.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.SoftwareNetwork.SqueezdPerSec
member.summary: The number of times the softirq handler function terminated per second because its budget was consumed or the time limit was reached, but more work could have been done.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.SoftwareNetwork.Rx_rpsPerSec
member.summary: The number of times the CPU has been woken up per second to process packets via an inter-processor interrupt.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.SoftwareNetwork.Flw_limPerSec
member.summary: The number of times the flow limit has been reached per second. Flow limiting is an optional RPS feature that can be used to limit the number of packets queued to the backlog for each flow to a certain amount. This can help ensure that smaller flows are processed even though much larger flows are pushing packets in.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.SwappingStatistics.PSwpinPerSec
member.summary: Total number of swap pages the system brought in per second.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.SwappingStatistics.PSwpoutPerSec
member.summary: Total number of swap pages the system brought out per second.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.SwapSpaceUtilization.Kbswpfree
member.summary: Amount of free swap space in kilobytes.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.SwapSpaceUtilization.Kbswpused
member.summary: Amount of used swap space in kilobytes.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.SwapSpaceUtilization.Swpused
member.summary: Percentage of used swap space.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.SwapSpaceUtilization.Kbswpcad
member.summary: Amount of cached swap memory in kilobytes. This is memory that once was swapped out, is swapped back in but still also is in the swap area (if memory is needed it doesn't need to be swapped out again because it is already in the swap area. This saves I/O).

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.SwapSpaceUtilization.Swpcad
member.summary: Percentage of cached swap memory in relation to the amount of used swap space.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.TaskCreationSwitching.ProcPerSec
member.summary: Total number of tasks created per second.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.TaskCreationSwitching.CSwchPerSec
member.summary: Total number of context switches per second.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.TransferRateStatistics.Tps
member.summary: Total number of transfers per second that were issued to physical devices. A transfer is an I/O request to a physical device. Multiple logical requests can be combined into a single I/O request to the device. A transfer is of indeterminate size.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.TransferRateStatistics.Rtps
member.summary: Total number of read requests per second issued to physical devices.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.TransferRateStatistics.Wtps
member.summary: Total number of write requests per second issued to physical devices.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.TransferRateStatistics.Dtps
member.summary: Total number of discard requests per second issued to physical devices.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.TransferRateStatistics.BreadPerSec
member.summary: Total amount of data read from the devices in blocks per second. Blocks are equivalent to sectors and therefore have a size of 512 bytes.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.TransferRateStatistics.BwrtnPerSec
member.summary: Total amount of data written to devices in blocks per second.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.TransferRateStatistics.BdscdPerSec
member.summary: Total amount of data discarded for devices in blocks per second.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.TTYDeviceActivity.RcvinPerSec
member.summary: Number of receive interrupts per second for current serial line. Serial line number is given in the TTY column.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.TTYDeviceActivity.TxmtinPerSec
member.summary: Number of transmit interrupts per second for current serial line.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.TTYDeviceActivity.FramerrPerSec
member.summary: Number of frame errors per second for current serial line.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.TTYDeviceActivity.PrtyerrPerSec
member.summary: Number of parity errors per second for current serial line.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.TTYDeviceActivity.BrkPerSec
member.summary: Number of breaks per second for current serial line.

member.name: P:SYSSTATS_Charter.TTYDeviceActivity.OvrunPerSec
member.summary: Number of overrun errors per second for current serial line.

member.name: F:SYSSTATS_Charter.SYSSTAT_Form.components
member.summary: Required designer variable.

member.name: M:SYSSTATS_Charter.SYSSTAT_Form.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Clean up any resources being used.
member.param: true if managed resources should be disposed; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:SYSSTATS_Charter.SYSSTAT_Form.InitializeComponent
member.summary: Required method for Designer support - do not modify the contents of this method with the code editor.
